pr_data.title: build: ESLint rule to check/add license headers
pr_data.body:
**What kind of change does this PR introduce?**

An EsLint rule to check/add Licence headers

**Did you add tests for your changes?**

I wrote the test for this rule, but I was unable to locate the tests for the other rules (extension.js and prettier-comments.js).

<!-- Explain the **motivation** for making this change. What existing problem does the pull request solve? -->

Resolves #11701

This rule checks if a license header exists and fixes the 2 cases:
1. No license.
FIX: Adds license header.
2. Header comment that is not the license. 
FIX: Adds licensing as header.

**Other information**
There is another case where the license comment may already exist in the file, but not as a header. 
Shall I cover this case as well, and implement a fix to move that comment so it is a header?

Please let me know if anything else is needed! :)

This reverts commit 50ef690aedcfcb6bbf583c795552dfbeee7a50e0.

Remove redundant file and implement PR suggestions

pr_data.title: feat: distinguish different Touches
pr_data.body:
<!-- Thanks for submitting a pull request! Please provide enough information so that others can review your pull request. -->

**What kind of change does this PR introduce?**

This PR adds the option of controlling a Touch, and only that Touch, after it has been created by a call to [`TouchScreen.touchStart`](https://github.com/puppeteer/puppeteer/blob/6174eb0453ee022370ce5178dc71aa83e7a30435/packages/puppeteer-core/src/api/Input.ts#L498).

Closes #13084 .

**Did you add tests for your changes?**

Yes.

**Summary**

In this PR, `TouchScreen.touchStart` returns a (promise of) a [`Touch`](https://github.com/emilefokkema/puppeteer/blob/4e4af5d7efc78ce46ddca78ad5f7502797008c99/packages/puppeteer-core/src/api/Input.ts#L476). This way, touches can be manipulated individually by calling [`Touch.move`](https://github.com/emilefokkema/puppeteer/blob/4e4af5d7efc78ce46ddca78ad5f7502797008c99/packages/puppeteer-core/src/api/Input.ts#L482) or [`Touch.end`](https://github.com/emilefokkema/puppeteer/blob/4e4af5d7efc78ce46ddca78ad5f7502797008c99/packages/puppeteer-core/src/api/Input.ts#L486).

**Does this PR introduce a breaking change?**

Well... [This test](https://github.com/emilefokkema/puppeteer/commit/45469a703ae3bee7788c33e534b57ce6b2e734d3) documents an aspect of the current behavior of `TouchScreen.touchStart`: two consecutive calls to it will not result in two `touchstart` events. This PR proceeds from the assumption that that behavior was in fact a bug: two consecutive calls to `TouchScreen.touchStart` _should_ result in two `touchstart` events. Seen in this way, this PR fixes a bug (in addition to adding new functionality). But if the current behavior of `TouchScreen.touchStart` was _not_ a bug, then this PR introduces a breaking change.

**Other information**

fix headers and remove unnecessary fields

This way, touches can be manipulated individually by calling [`Touch.move`](https://github.com/emilefokkema/puppeteer/blob/4e4af5d7efc78ce46ddca78ad5f7502797008c99/packages/puppeteer-core/src/api/Input.ts#L482) or [`Touch.end`](https://github.com/emilefokkema/puppeteer/blob/4e4af5d7efc78ce46ddca78ad5f7502797008c99/packages/puppeteer-core/src/api/Input.ts#L486).

**Does this PR introduce a breaking change?**

Well... [This test](https://github.com/emilefokkema/puppeteer/commit/45469a703ae3bee7788c33e534b57ce6b2e734d3) documents an aspect of the current behavior of `TouchScreen.touchStart`: two consecutive calls to it will not result in two `touchstart` events. pr_data.title: fix: use correct paper format units
pr_data.body:
When format is set, we didn't convert the internal values (in inches) to the expected measuring system, for Firefox and WebDriver BiDi the expected unit is centimeters, but we were providing the value in inches.

Now, all supported paper format have defined sizes in both centimeters and inches and when PDF options are parsed, we will returned size of the selected format in provided unit.

Fix #13515
commit_messages:
fix: use correct paper format units

When format is set, we didn't convert the internal values (in inches) to the expected measuring system, for Firefox and WebDriver BiDi the expected unit is centimeters, but we were providing the value in inches.

Now, all supported paper format have defined sizes in both centimeters and inches and when PDF options are parsed, we will returned size of the selected format in provided unit.

Fix #13515
pr_data.body_cleaned:
When format is set, we didn't convert the internal values (in inches) to the expected measuring system, for Firefox and WebDriver BiDi the expected unit is centimeters, but we were providing the value in inches.

Now, all supported paper format have defined sizes in both centimeters and inches and when PDF options are parsed, we will returned size of the selected format in provided unit.

Fix #13515

pr_data.title: Updated website/versioned_docs/version-24.10.1/webdriver-bidi.md
pr_data.body:
Closes: #13937

<!-- Thanks for submitting a pull request! Please provide enough information so that others can review your pull request. -->

**What kind of change does this PR introduce?**

Lists 'request.resourceType()' as not supported over WebDriver BiDi.

**Did you add tests for your changes?**

No

**If relevant, did you update the documentation?**

Yes

**Summary**

Added `HTTPRequest.resourceType()` to the list of Puppeteer features not supported over WebDriver BiDi for Firefox 139.0.4, as this was previously undocumented in https://pptr.dev/webdriver-bidi#puppeteer-features-not-supported-over-webdriver-bidi.

<!-- Try to link to an open issue for more information. -->

**Does this PR introduce a breaking change?**

No

**Other information**
